_header: That witten all that ever been
Subjects: charters; John of Beverley, saint; Athelstan, king
_description: A Rhyming Charter of King Athelstan to St. John of Beverlay — in couplets

BodDod10.First Lines:
That witten all that euer beeneThat this Chartet hearen and
                    seene…
BodDod10.Last Lines:
… God helpe all those ilke menThat helpe to the
                    Thowen
BodDod10.Attributed Title:
Charta Regis Adlestain ecclesie sancti Johanis Beuerlaii (f.
                        43v)

BodDod95.First Lines:
þat written alle þat euer beenþat þis Chartre
                    heren and seen…
BodDod95.Last Lines:
…God help alle þas ilk men þat helpes to the
                    thowen
BodDod95.Attributed Title:
The Ryming Charter of King Athelstan to Seint John of Beuerlay (f.
                        32v)

BodDod116.First Lines:
That witten all that euer beeneThat this Charter hearen and
                    seene…
BodDod116.Last Lines:
…God Helpe all those ilke men þat helps to the
                    thowen
BodDod116.Attributed Title: Carta Adelstani facta sancto Johanni Beuerlai (f. 116)

BLCottCharIV18.First Lines:
Þat witen alle þat euir beenþat þis chartre
                    heven and seen…
BLCottCharIV18.Last Lines:
…God help alle þas ilk menþat helpes to þe
                    thowen
BLCottCharIV18.Note: Single leaf. 81 lines. Written as prose.

BLLan269.First Lines:
That written all that euer beeneThat this charter heven &
                    seene…
BLLan269.Last Lines:
…Send ther writt soone ananThat his manser man be
                    tan
BLLan269.Attributed Title:
Charta Regis Adelstani Ecclesiae Sancti Johannis Beuerlaei (f.
                    213)
BLLan269.Editions:
Birch,  Walter de Gray. 
             Cartularium Saxonicum.
         3 vols. London: Whiting, 1885-93: 2.322.

CantM251.First Lines:
Þat wyte alle þat nouþ beþþat þis
                    writ y hureþ and yseþ…
CantM251.Last Lines:
…Þys writt was yȝiue at CandelmasseIn þe Suxe
                    and Tuentyþe more Ne lasseþe Date of Edward houre kynghegod
                    him ȝiue god endyngge
CantM251.Note:
A much later, and not very accurate transcription bears the same
                    reference number: ‘Copy of an Instrument in old English & in
                    Verse’.
